title: Wenona girls take early Ferrari lessons
text:
If you want your daughters to fully appreciate the colour of money, send them to wealthy Sydney girls' school Wenona.

The Ferrari Club of Australia's NSW chapter sent a note to its members on Friday, asking: "Would you be interested in displaying your Ferrari at Wenona School? The school would like five Ferraris there." Aren't modern chicks getting demanding – whatever happened to a pony?

A Wenona girl's wheels of choice: the Ferrari FF, which retails at $625,000. Supplied

The Ferrari owners, who incidentally "are very welcome to talk to the girls about the car(s)", have "done this previously at Wenona and it's a tremendous joy to see the excitement these kids have with our cars".

Presumably not as joyful as the day the Wenona parents meet their daughter's first Ferrari-driving boyfriend, who lives upstairs from his family's corner store while he saves up his cocaine-dealing money for the deposit on a lock-up storage facility. Either that or he's thrice-divorced, wears a toupee and owns a knocking shop in Lidcombe. Forget university – it's a noble path to tread, being a gangster's moll, and don't let anyone else tell you otherwise, sister!
description: Sydney's wealthy girls' school Wenona is looking for five Ferraris to show its pupils. As you do.
